metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16541 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Tor Browser before 7.0.9 on macOS and Linux allows remote attackers to bypass the intended anonymity feature and discover a client IP address via vectors involving a crafted web site that leverages file:// mishandling in Firefox, aka TorMoil. NOTE: Tails is unaffected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-globalmenu - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-testsuite - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
